did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library

bioghist.p: Dr. Jacob Seidenberg (1914-1996) was a government official who specialized in labor arbitration and non-discrimination contracts, and wrote extensively on labor law and negotiations. He graduated from Temple University in 1937 and received a law degree from the University of Pennsylvania Law School in 1941. During the 1940s he was an attorney with the U.S. War Department, the National War Labor Board and the National Wage Stabilization Board. In 1948 he went to graduate school at Cornell University, from which he earned his Ph.D. in industrial and labor relations in 1951. In 1951 he joined the staff of the President's Committee on Government Contract Compliance. The Committee was abolished by President Dwight D. Eisenhower in August 1953 by Executive Order 10479 and was succeeded by the President's Committee on Government Contracts. Seidenberg was appointed Executive Director of the new committee and served until January 1960 when he resigned to become a full-time labor arbitrator. The Committee was responsible for enforcing non-discrimination clauses in government contracts, worked with private businesses to help them overcome job discrimination, and developed educational programs against ethnic and racial discrimination. The chairman was Vice President Richard Nixon, and the vice chairman was Secretary of Labor James P. Mitchell. In later years Seidenberg served on a number of boards of inquiry involving labor disputes. From 1970 to 1975 he was chairman of the Federal Services Impasses Panel which settled deadlocks in federal labor negotiations.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

scopecontent.p: 3/28/89 -3/9/90. Seniority, this was a cancelled case.
1/19/94 -2/25/94. School's & college's; workload, transfer. Teacher's position on unresolved issues presented to fact finding panel, in a folder.
4/22/75 -4/20/89. Rates of pay, overtime, lunch period, premium pay.
7/31/92 -10/14/92. Assignment of jobs, workload, workweek, rates of pay, incentive pay, sick leave, leaves of absence.
9/18/91 - 12/14/91. Vacancy, assignment of jobs, premium pay. Some related cases from other companies.
1/94. Reinstatement, termination of employment, compensation. Transcripts & agreements.
7/28/94- 11/21/94. Premium pay, assignment of jobs, rates of pay.
5/94. Rates of pay, premium pay. Exhibits.
6/94. Assignment of jobs, rates of pay. Exhibits.
6/94. Premium pay, assignment of jobs. Exhibits.
6/20/86- 11/14/87. Assignment of jobs, contract interpretation, seniority. Exhibits.
5/94 - 6/94. Assignment of jobs, rates of pay, premium pay, call-in. Exhibits.
4/25/92- 1/14/94. Contract interpretation, job classification, assignment of jobs. Exhibits.
News from U.S. Department of Labor.
Agreement with Air Line Pilots Association International. Not in a folder.
10/24/88- 11/4/88. Assignment of jobs, promotion, back pay, contract interpretation.
Articles open prior to mediation. Workload, salaries, fringe benefits.
Formal advisory opinions, constitution and by-laws, code of professional responsibility for arbitrators of Labor - Management disputes.
2/25/93 - 10/15/93. Arbitrability, union security, seniority, termination of employment.
6/28/88 - 4/13/89. Discipline, termination of employment, back pay-
6/9/92. Memorandum about system wide training unit, school improvement training unit.
11/1/94. Formal investigation and correspondence, transcripts of investigation.
4/18/93 - 3/8/94. Transcript of testimony taken in formal investigation.
10/6/92 - 10/4/94. Compensation, termination of employment, suspension. Formal investigation transcripts.
6/2/94 - 2/2/95. Compensation, suspension. Transcripts from formal investigation.
7/10/91 - 4/19/95. Seniority, premium pay, termination of employment, fringe benefits, reinstatement.
5/2/94. Seniority, assignment of jobs. Employees submission to PLB #4948 with exhibits.
5/2/94. Elimination of jobs. Employees submission to PLB #4948 with exhibits.
Suspension, compensation, elimination of jobs, seniority.
6/7/93. Reinstatement, seniority, compensation, termination of employment.
2/87 - 9/14/87. Discipline, back pay, medical release/physical exam.
9/20/94. Transcript of proceedings - medical release/ physical exam.
3/30/93. reinstatement, seniority, back pay, medical release/physical exam.
8/6/92 - 3/20/93. Termination of employment, back pay, suspension.
7/22/91 - 3/23/95. Reinstatement, seniority, back pay, suspension, medical release/physical exam, discipline.
5/24/94. Suspension, compensation, reinstatement, back pay, seniority.
6/10/93. Crew size. **exhibits and transcripts of case follow the folder.
5/24/94 -10/25/94. Discipline, compensation, reinstatement, seniority, back pay.
7/29/94. Reinstatement, seniority, back pay. Transcript of this case follows folder.
2/24/92 -7/29/94. Reinstatement, seniority, back pay, discipline, compensation, suspension.
2/3/87 -10/25/94. Assignment of jobs, discipline, rates of pay.
1/14/92 -5/28/93. Suspension, compensation, reinstatement, seniority, medical release/ physical exams, fringe benefits.
5/31/88 - 7/9/90. Termination of employment, back pay, compensation, discipline, reinstatement, alcoholism/drug abuse.
8/17/91 -9/30/91. Suspension, compensation, seniority, discipline, reinstatement, back pay.
3/28/94 -3/23/95. Assignment of jobs, rates of pay,
1993 policy directives concerning Equal Employment Opportunity and other employment practices.
8/16/89 -10/10/89. Suspension, contract interpretation, termination of employment. Transcript follows folder.

did.unittitle: Book: The Crew Size Dispute in the Railroad Industry.
Folder with various pamphlets, correspondence and transcripts.
